definition: to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: My paranoid supporters thought I’d been set up by somebody.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些多疑的支持者們認爲我是被某人算計了。

sentences.english: Work out how much all these things will cost.
sentences.chinese: 算計算計買這麼多東西要多少錢。

sentences.english: Work out how much all these things will cost.
sentences.chinese: 算計算計買這麼多東西要多少錢。

sentences.english: De Roquefort’s voice had a calculating and deflationary effect.
sentences.chinese: 雷孟達的聲音有着算計和緊縮的效果。

sentences.english: Make surprise threats and force him to spend time calculating.
sentences.chinese: 製造意外的威脅，迫使對方化費時間算計。

sentences.english: Group-to-group relations are more often marked by calculation, rivalry and coldness.
sentences.chinese: 羣體關係的特點更多的是算計，競爭與冷血。

sentences.english: Aunt Wang is planning to buy a colour TV set next month.
sentences.chinese: 王大媽算計着下月買一臺彩電。

sentences.english: The Japanese are calculating, cunning, and wicked.
sentences.chinese: 日本人是精於算計的，狡猾的，缺德的。

sentences.english: Kosygin gave the impression of doing so on the basis of skillful calculation .
sentences.chinese: 柯西金這樣做時給人的印象是經過巧妙算計的。

sentences.english: Among the small, Math calculations, this is really boring.
sentences.chinese: 加減乘除之中的小小算計，這真是無趣。

sentences.english: I’m a score-keeper, always calculating who has done what.
sentences.chinese: 我是個斤斤計較的人，老是算計着誰誰做了什麼。

sentences.english: I'm thrilled that we can help others. I'm blown away by how much it has helped us.
sentences.chinese: 我爲能幫助他人而興奮，爲算計自我所得而落寞。

sentences.english: If not, then what factors influence our decisions?
sentences.chinese: 如果算計，那麼哪些因素影響了我們的決定呢？

sentences.english: I'm very cost-conscious, in terms of how to get the big bang on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 我很會算計成本，知道如何在把刺激搬上銀幕。

sentences.english: Till he was seventy, Jesse figured, giving himself three more years.
sentences.chinese: 到七十歲吧，他算計到，再多給自己三年時間。

definition: to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to involve/to implicate/to be interrelated
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
should not/to owe nothing
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to blame/to rebuke
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
to blame/to criticize/condemnation/reproach
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
one's conduct and deeds
malicious
